articles.title: Chinese Hackers Deploy SpiceRAT and SugarGh0st in Global Espionage Campaign

A malvertising campaign is leveraging trojanized installers for popular software such as Google Chrome and Microsoft Teams to drop a backdoor called Oyster (aka Broomstick and CleanUpLoader).

Affecting all versions of the software prior to and including Serv-U 15.4.2

articles.title: Void Arachne Uses Deepfakes and AI to Deliver Malicious VPNs to Chinese Users

articles.title: Cybercriminals Exploit Free Software Lures to Deploy Hijack Loader and Vidar Stealer

articles.title: China-Linked Hackers Infiltrate East Asian Firm for 3 Years Using F5 Devices

articles.description: Traditional application security practices are not effective in the modern DevOps world. The overhead that degrades velocity and puts production deadlines at risk.

articles.title: NiceRAT Malware Targets South Korean Users via Cracked Software

articles.title: U.K. Hacker Linked to Notorious Scattered Spider Group Arrested in Spain

As cyber threats loom large and data breaches continue to pose increasingly significant risks. Organizations and industries that handle sensitive information and valuable assets make prime targets for cybercriminals seeking financial gain or strategic advantage.

articles.title: Why Regulated Industries are Turning to Military-Grade Cyber Defenses

articles.title: ZKTeco Biometric System Found Vulnerable to 24 Critical Security Flaws

articles.title: North Korean Hackers Target Brazilian Fintech with Sophisticated Phishing Tactics

articles.title: Cybercriminals Employ PhantomLoader to Distribute SSLoad Malware

articles.title: Google Warns of Pixel Firmware Security Flaw Exploited as Zero-Day
